UiWidgetAdapterTestSelectedValue, UiWidgetAdapterTestStringField, UiWidgetAdapterTestTabPanel, UiWidgetAdapterTestTree

    public interface UiWidgetAdapter
extends AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeWriteAttribute
    This is the interface that adapts to the native widget of the underlying toolkit implementation for a native widget.
    It is a design trade-off as java does not have multi-inheritance (we would need scala traits here). This way it is possible to implement an abstract base-implementation for the types of the UiWidget-hierarchy and inherit different implementations (Swing, SWT, GWT, etc.) from that without creating redundant code.
    ATTENTION:
    The getters (AttributeRead* methods) of attributes that cannot be changed by the end-user are never used and therefore NOT implemented properly.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getToplevelWidget

        Object getToplevelWidget()
        Returns:
        the native widget.
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidgetFactoryNative.getNativeWidget(net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.UiWidgetRegular)

      • removeFromParent

        void removeFromParent()
        This method removes the widget from its parent. After this method, the widget is detached from the UI.

      • setParent

        void setParent(UiWidgetComposite<?> parent)
        This method gets called whenever the parent of the according UiWidget is changed. It does nothing by default but may be overridden to deal with special behavior of native UI toolkits.
        Parameters:
        parent - is the new parent or null if removed from parent.

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible,
                boolean programmatic)
        Parameters:
        visible - - true to set visible (show), false to set invisible (hide).
        programmatic - - see UiEvent.isProgrammatic().
        See Also:
        AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced.setVisible(boolean, boolean)

      • setMode

        void setMode(boolean editMode)
        This method is called from UiModeChanger for AttributeWriteMode.setMode(net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common.UiMode). It only handles the predefined UiModes.
        Parameters:
        editMode - - true of UiMode.EDIT and false for UiMode.VIEW.

      • createAbsoluteImageUrl

        String createAbsoluteImageUrl(String relativePath)
        This method creates an absolute URL from the given relativePath.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - is the relative path (URL suffix) to the image.
        Returns:
        the absolute URL.
        See Also:
        UiConfiguration.getTheme()

      • createLabel

        UiWidgetLabel createLabel(UiContext context)
        This method creates the label for this widget. Depending on the underlying toolkit implementation the native widget may already contain the label (applies e.g. for FormItem in SmartGWT). In such case this method will wrap it as UiWidgetLabel. Otherwise this method should create a new UiWidgetLabel and return it.
        Parameters:
        context - is the UiContext that may be used to create the label.
        Returns:
        the label.

      • isStyleDeltaSupported

        boolean isStyleDeltaSupported()
        This method determines if the style delta operations AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced.addStyle(String), AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced.removeStyle(String) and AttributeWritePrimaryStyle.setPrimaryStyle(String) are supported by this widget adapter. Otherwise such operations are always performed via the AttributeWriteStyles.setStyles(String) method. If supported the delta operations are preferred as they are assumed to be more efficient.
        Returns:
        true if style delta operations are supported, false otherwise.

      • setEventSender

        void setEventSender(UiFeatureEvent source,
                    UiHandlerEvent sender)
        This method registers the given event handler in the widget. This method will be called only once.
        Parameters:
        source - is the event source.
        sender - is the UiHandlerEvent where the events are send to. This is actually an adapter that dispatches the events to the individual listeners registered in the widget.
